text: The voiced alveolar implosive is a type of consonantal sound, used in some spoken languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is . The IPA symbol is lowercase letter d with a rightward hook protruding from the upper right of the letter. ==Features== Features of the voiced alveolar implosive: ==Occurrence== {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language !! Word !! IPA !! Meaning !! Notes |- |Arabic |Bahrani Arabic | | |'house' |Corresponds to in Standard Arabic and other varieties. See Arabic phonology |- |colspan=2| Ega ||colspan=2 align=center| || 'hide' || |- |colspan=2| Fula || || || 'two' || |- |colspan=2| Goemai || || || 'to swallow' || |- |colspan=2| Hausa || || || 'one at a time' || |- |colspan=2| Jamaican || || || 'them' || Allophone of in the onset of prominent syllables |- |colspan=2| Kalabari || || || 'father' || |- |colspan=2| Karajá || || || 'bone' || |- |colspan=2| Khmer || || || 'ten' || |- |colspan=2| Mono || || || 'debt' || |- |colspan=2| Ongota ||colspan=2 align=center| || 'dull' || |- | colspan="2' | Paumarí |||| ||'old' |- |colspan=2| Seereer-Siin || || || 'flower' || Contrasts phonemically with voiceless implosive |- |colspan=2| Sindhi || || || 'crevice' || |- |colspan=2| Tera || || || 'to talk' || |- |colspan=2| Tukang Besi ||colspan=2 align=center| || 'rubbish' || |- |colspan=2| Vietnamese || || || 'tail' ||In free variation with . See Vietnamese phonology |- |colspan=2| Wambule ||colspan=2 align=center| || 'name' || |} ==See also== * Index of phonetics articles * Voiceless alveolar implosive ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * ==External links== * Category:Alveolar consonants Category:Implosives Category:Central consonants Category:Voiced oral consonants
title: Voiced alveolar implosive
